message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.IR. 

This paper is about data-to-text generation using neural network architectures, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). The paper proposes a new entity-centric neural architecture for data-to-text generation, which involves representation learning and hierarchical attention mechanisms. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which covers NLP and related topics. The paper also involves training large-scale datasets and using neural network architectures, which are common in machine learning and deep learning research. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also likely sub-categories. The paper also involves dynamic updating of entity-specific representations, which is related to neural networks with memory, and therefore cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is another likely sub-category. Finally, the paper involves information retrieval and content selection, which is related to cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
